pr_title: Fixed the check for string equality by DT

timeline.message:
Fixed the check for string equality
Doesn't call login logic if the auth token has not changed

timeline.bodyText:
I think we can just leave the first part of the check (authToken != null && !authToken.equalsIgnoreCase(_authToken)).
It will return true if the new token is not null and is different from the current one. The second condition enables one case: when the new token is null and the old token is not null. I'm not sure when we could encounter that and not sure if we want to run login in that case.
timeline.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText:
Don't we need the second case for the logout case?
When setting the email to null, shouldn't we also be removing the authToken.
replies.author: davidtruong

replies.bodyText: If email is null, isInitialized() will be false and the inner conditional won't be executed.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText: Does this flow allow us to set authToken to null?
replies.author: Ayyanchira

replies.bodyText: Oh yeah, you're right. If current token is not null, we can set it to null. If it's already null, we don't do anything.
replies.author: vbabenkoru

replies.bodyText: But then we will never be able to set it to null...
replies.author: Ayyanchira

timeline.message: calls login if the auth handler is not implemented.
